snippet: Compounding pharmacies, now facing their biggest regulatory threat, have staved off tougher federal oversight with the help of allies in Congress.
abstract: Drug compounders at center of deadly meningitis outbreak have staved off tougher federal oversight for more than two decades with help of powerful allies in Congress; niche industry is facing new regulatory threat as it confronts questions at Congressional hearings over the deadly outbreak.

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and SABRINA TAVERNISE

lead_paragraph: Compounding pharmacies, now facing their biggest regulatory threat, have staved off tougher federal oversight with the help of allies in Congress.

headline.seo: Drug Compounders Get Help on Capitol Hill
headline.main: Friends in Congress Have Helped Drug Compounders Avoid Tighter Rules
headline.print_headline: Friends in Congress Have Helped Drug Compounders Avoid Tighter Rules
